IpamPrefixListResolverRule.description: CIDR selection rules define the business logic for selecting CIDRs from IPAM.  If a CIDR matches any of the rules, it will be included. If a rule has multiple conditions, the CIDR has to match every condition of that rule. You can create a prefix list resolver without rules, but you'll need to add at least one rule before it can actually automate your prefix list updates.

Conditions.description: Two of the rule types allow you to add conditions to the rules. (1) For IPAM Pool CIDR rules, you can specify an ipamPoolId; if not specified, the rule will apply to all IPAM Pool CIDRs in the scope.  (2) For IPAM Resource CIDR rules, you can specify resourceId, resourceOwner, resourceRegion, cidr, or resourceTag.

IpamScopeId.description: This rule will only match resources that are in this IPAM Scope.

ResourceType.description: The resourceType property only applies to ipam-resource-cidr rules; this property specifies what type of resources this rule will apply to, such as VPCs or Subnets.

RuleType.description: There are three rule types: (1) Static CIDR: A fixed list of CIDRs that don't change (like a manual list replicated across Regions). (2) IPAM pool CIDR: CIDRs from specific IPAM pools (like all CIDRs from your IPAM production pool).  (3) IPAM resource CIDR: CIDRs for AWS resources like VPCs, subnets, and EIPs within a specific IPAM scope.

StaticCidr.description: A fixed CIDR that doesn't change

IpamPrefixListResolverRuleCondition.description: Two of the rule types allow you to add conditions to the rules. (1) For IPAM Pool CIDR rules, you can specify an ipamPoolId; if not specified, the rule will apply to all IPAM Pool CIDRs in the scope.  (2) For IPAM Resource CIDR rules, you can specify resourceId, resourceOwner, resourceRegion, cidr, or resourceTag.

Cidr.description: Condition for the IPAM Resource CIDR rule type.  CIDR (like 10.24.34.0/23).

IpamPoolId.description: Condition for the IPAM Pool CIDR rule type.  If not chosen, the resolver applies to all IPAM Pool CIDRs in the scope.

Operation.description: Equals, Not equals, or Subnet Of.  The subnet-of operation only applies to cidr conditions.

ResourceId.description: Condition for the IPAM Resource CIDR rule type.  The unique ID of a resource (like vpc-1234567890abcdef0).

ResourceOwner.description: Condition for the IPAM Resource CIDR rule type.  Resource owner (like 111122223333).

ResourceRegion.description: Condition for the IPAM Resource CIDR rule type.  Resource region (like us-east-1).

ResourceTag.description: Condition for the IPAM Resource CIDR rule type.  Resource Tag (like dev-vpc-1).

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

AddressFamily.description: The address family of the address space in this Prefix List Resolver. Either IPv4 or IPv6.

IpamArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IPAM this Prefix List Resolver is a part of.

IpamId.description: The Id of the IPAM this Prefix List Resolver is a part of.

IpamPrefixListResolverArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IPAM Prefix List Resolver

IpamPrefixListResolverId.description: Id of the IPAM Prefix List Resolver.

Rules.description: Rules define the business logic for selecting CIDRs from IPAM.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.
